wikipedia_page.main: John McLeod Campbell,  (6 July 1884 – 26 February 1961) was an English Anglican priest, chaplain, and missionary. He served as Fellow and Chaplain of Hertford College, Oxford from 1909 to 1924, as Principal of Trinity College, Kandy from 1924 to 1935, as General Secretary of the Overseas Council (formerly the Missionary Council) of the Church Assembly from 1935 to 1953, and as Chaplain to the Speaker of the House of Commons from 1955 until his death in 1961. He additionally served as a military chaplain during the First World War.
